;;我长大的印度刚刚获得独立，正在努力满足食品、燃料和外汇等基本需求。按卡路里含量计算，中国现在是世界第二大食品生产国，也是食品净出口国。印度仍然进口燃料，但越来越多地利用太阳能和风能。外汇储备创历史新高。印度目前是世界第五大经济体，一些分析师预测到 2027 年可能成为第三大经济体。

;

;过去，在在与多边组织和投资者的谈判中，印度经常被描述为一个具有巨大潜力的国家，并且将继续保持下去。多年来，这种嘲笑或许并不完全不公平：印度的进步时断时续。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;1991-93 年的国际收支危机是一个重要的过程宏观经济稳定和结构改革的修正。 1996 年和 1998-2004 年，在阿塔尔·比哈里·瓦杰帕伊 (Atal Bihari Vajpayee) 的领导下，发生了进一步的重大变化：电信和公路网络得到了扩展，提高了生产力，将欠发达地区与先进地区结合起来，并刺激了印度制造业的竞争。 2003 年的财政责任和预算管理 (;FRBM;) 法案标志着另一个转折点，强调了经济稳定对私人投资的重要性。但从 2004 年到 2014 年，改革步伐放缓。

;

;然而，在过去十年中，印度坚决反驳了“潜力国家”的俏皮话。国际货币基金组织将该国描述为经济“亮点”。印度国家银行的研究发现，在最近 4 月至 3 月的财政年度中，增量资本产出比（衡量投资与 GDP 增长之间关系的指标）稳步下降至 4.4 ，与十年前的 7.5 相比。这表明印度的增长部分源于少花钱多生产。

;

;印度为自己设定了到 2047 年成为发达经济体的目标，今年是其独立一百周年。需要重点关注哪些问题才能实现这一目标？

;

;首先是贫困问题。对于一个拥有 14 亿人口的人口稠密国家来说，消除这种现象必定是任何有意义的经济战略存在的理由。如果你接受印度对贫困的官方定义——每天收入略低于 2 美元——那么农村贫困率估计为 2.5%，城市贫困率为 1%。这些估计未考虑各种政府计划提供的免费食品和其他直接转移福利。尽管如此，印度应该瞄准更高的目标。必须消除贫困，同时将官方定义从当前水平提高到每日收入至少 3 美元，最好是 3.50 美元。

;
;< div>;
;
;
;
;

;第二个任务就是通过实施;FRBM;法案来维持宏观经济稳定。根据该法，中央和州政府的财政赤字将减少至<小>;GDP;的3％，债务与<小>;GDP;的比率将减少至60%。二十年后，这仍然没有发生。

;

;应对 covid-19 大流行所需的公共支出增加使这些目标更加难以实现。然而，自疫情爆发以来，情况有所改善：2023-24财年可能的财政赤字预算预计将收窄至;GDP;的5.8%，政府希望将其减少2025-26 年将增至 4.5%。公共债务似乎也在下降，从 2020-21 年的近 90% 下降到 ;GDP; 的 80%。除此之外，如果政府继续将更多支出转向资产创造资本项目，生产率将会提高。

;

;第三个大问题是应对气候变化。印度正在通过 2015 年《巴黎协定》中的“国家自主贡献”积极发挥自己的作用。它也是部门倡议的领导者，例如由 118 个国家组成的政府间组织国际太阳能联盟。它已开始重组农业，减少对化石燃料的依赖，例如转向生产小米等能源密集度较低的谷物。印度正在向绿色氢投入大量资金。

;

;但印度要大幅减少对化石燃料的依赖，还有很长的路要走。有序转型需要提高国有配电公司的效率，逐步淘汰效率低下的化石燃料发电厂，并加快向可再生能源供电电网的转变。国家层面的改变还不够。它还需要国际社会采取行动，尤其是根据 ;G20; 独立专家组的建议进一步改革多边开发银行。

;

;第四个值得关注的领域是技能发展。印度抚养比（年轻人口或老年人口的比例）不断下降，使得提高技能和推出新技术（包括提供更好的在线课程）变得更加重要。政府的新国民教育政策正在使国家走上正轨。它还可能有助于将大部分灰色经济纳入正规部门。

;

;印度必须开发一种依赖技术的新增长模式而不是更多增量和材料密集型制造业以及出口导向型增长。印度永远不会成为制造业出口强国。其未来增长的最大希望在于关注资本支出并进一步发展其服务业。

;

;地缘政治风险使能源更加昂贵或中断关键供应链将带来挑战。但他们不会让印度脱轨。该国最近担任;G20主席国;以及由此产生的新德里领导人宣言，表明了如何平衡与美国和俄罗斯的关系，例如允许印度继续以可承受的价格进口石油。作为一个需求未饱和、不断增长的大型市场，印度完全有能力将地缘政治的不确定性转化为优势。

;

;印度领导人有充分的理由想要实现四大目标。他们明白，政治稳定取决于强劲的经济增长以及通过技术支持的公共分配系统和各种补贴支付有效提供公共产品。这可能最终是印度的时刻。 ;■;

;;我;;在格雷格·伊根 (Greg Egan) 的小说《排列城市》; 中，角色 Peer 获得了永生在他完全控制的虚拟现实中，他发现自己非常无聊。因此，他让自己拥有了新的激情。某一时刻，他正在突破高等数学的界限；另一时刻，他正在突破高等数学的界限。接下来他正在写歌剧。 “他甚至一度对极乐世界（来世）感兴趣。不再。他更喜欢考虑桌腿。”皮尔的反复无常与更深层次的问题有关。当技术解决了人类最深层的问题时，还剩下什么要做？

;

;这是尼克·博斯特罗姆（Nick Bostrom）在一本新书中考虑的一个问题。牛津大学哲学家，他的;上一本书;认为人类面临着未来 100 年，有六分之一的机会被消灭，这或许是由于危险形式的人工智能 (;AI;) 的发展造成的。在博斯特罗姆先生的最新出版物《深度乌托邦》中，他考虑了一个截然不同的结果。如果;AI ;运行得非常顺利，会发生什么？在书中提出的一种情况下，该技术发展到可以以接近零成本完成所有具有经济价值的工作的程度。在更激进的场景下，即使是你认为应该由人类完成的任务，比如养育孩子，也可以通过;人工智能;来完成。; ;这听起来可能比乌托邦，但 Bostrom 先生认为并非如此。

;
;
;
;
;;
;

;从第一个场景开始，博斯特罗姆先生将其称为“后稀缺”乌托邦。在这样的世界里，对工作的需求将会减少。大约一个世纪前，约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯 (John Maynard Keynes) 写了一篇题为《我们的孙辈的经济可能性》的文章，其中预测 100 年后，他富有的后代每周只需工作 15 个小时。这虽然还没有完全实现，但工作时间却大大减少了。在富裕国家，平均每周工作时间已从 19 世纪末的 60 多小时下降到如今的不足 40 小时。典型的美国人将三分之一的醒着时间花在休闲活动和运动上。未来，他们可能希望把时间花在人类当前概念之外的事情上。正如博斯特罗姆先生所写，在强大技术的帮助下，“我们可能体验的空间远远超出了我们目前尚未优化的大脑所能获得的体验。”

;

;然而，博斯特罗姆先生关于“后稀缺”乌托邦的标签可能有点误导：超级智能引起的经济爆炸仍然受到物质资源的限制，尤其是土地。尽管太空探索可能会极大地增加可用的建筑空间，但它不会使其变得无限。也有一些中间世界，人类在那里发展出强大的新智能形式，但并没有成为太空旅行者。在这样的世界中，财富可能是巨大的，但其中很大一部分可以被住房吸收——就像当今富裕国家的情况一样。

;

; 能够提升其所有者地位的“地位商品”也仍然可能存在，而且从本质上来说是稀缺的。即使人工智能在艺术、智力、音乐和体育方面超越人类，人类也可能会继续从超越人类同胞中获得价值；例如，拥有最热门活动的门票。 1977 年，经济学家弗雷德·赫希 (Fred Hirsch) 在《增长的社会限制》一书中指出，随着财富的增加，人类欲望的更大一部分由地位商品组成。花在竞争上的时间增加，这些商品的价格上涨，因此它们在 GDP 中所占的份额也随之增加。这种模式可能会在;AI;乌托邦中继续存在。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;博斯特罗姆先生指出，某些类型的竞争是协调失败：如果每个人都同意停止竞争，他们就有时间去做其他更好的事情，这可以进一步促进增长。然而，某些类型的竞争，例如体育运动，具有内在价值，值得保留。 （人类可能也没有更好的事情可做。）自从 1997 年 IBM 的“深蓝”首次击败当时的世界冠军加里·卡斯帕罗夫以来，人们对国际象棋的兴趣与日俱增。围绕电子竞技形成了一个完整的产业，计算机可以轻松击败人类；他们的收入预计在未来十年以每年 20% 的速度增长，到 2032 年将达到近 110 亿美元。当今社会的一些群体让我们了解未来人类可能如何度过他们的时间。贵族和波西米亚人喜欢艺术。僧侣们生活在自己的内心。运动员一生都在运动中度过。退休后涉足所有这些追求。

;;

;每个人都提前退休了

;

;像养育孩子这样的任务不会仍然存在吗？人类的避难所？博斯特罗姆先生不太确定。他认为，在后稀缺世界之外还有一个“后工具”世界，在这个世界中，<小>;人工智能;也将在儿童保育方面成为超人。凯恩斯本人写道：“我认为，没有哪个国家、没有哪个民族能够毫无恐惧地展望悠闲和富裕的时代。因为我们已经接受了太久的训练，不去奋斗，不去享受……从今天世界上任何一个地区的富裕阶层的行为和成就来判断，前景都非常令人沮丧！”圣经说得更简洁：“闲着的手是魔鬼的作坊。”

;

;这些动态表明了“进步的悖论”。尽管大多数人都想要一个更美好的世界，但如果技术变得太先进，他们可能会失去目标。博斯特罗姆先生认为，大多数人仍然会喜欢具有内在价值的活动，例如吃美味的食物。乌托邦主义者认为生活变得太容易了，他们可能会决定挑战自己，也许通过殖民一个新星球来尝试从头开始重新设计文明。然而，到了某个时候，即使是这样的冒险也可能不再值得。正如皮尔在《排列城市》中所做的那样，人类会在激情之间快乐地跳跃多久，这是一个悬而未决的问题。长期以来，经济学家一直认为人类拥有“无限的需求和欲望”，这表明人们想要消费的东西有无穷无尽的变化。随着<小>;人工智能;乌托邦的到来，这将受到考验。很大程度上取决于结果。 ;■;

;;F;;或几乎;只要在中国被接受“致富光荣” ，据了解;出去也可以是光荣的。许多刚富裕起来的中国公民的移民冲动是“投资移民”业务增长的一个重要原因。据该行业的游说团体投资移民委员会称，80多个国家提供了一些计划，为进行大量投资的外国人提供快速居留权（“黄金签证”），甚至公民身份（“黄金护照”）。总和。最受欢迎的是美国，到 2022 年，中国申请人的等候名单将达到 15 年。对于瓦努阿图、圣基茨和尼维斯等小国来说，投资入籍计划是重要的外汇来源。

;< p data-component="paragraph" class="css-1f0x4sl e1tt35bk0">;中国是最大的需求来源，但远非唯一。世界各地的人们都想移居其他国家——逃离迫害、政治不稳定，或者在某些情况下逃离正义。许多人只是希望让孩子接受更好的教育，或者在气候宜人、美食丰富的地方工作。他们给东道国带来的资金似乎使这种安排实现了双赢。然而，正如近年来许多计划的关闭所表明的那样，它们极具争议性。

;在每个国家，谁有权在那里居住的问题是一个敏感的人。但对于欧盟（;EU;）来说，黄金签证尤其引发了根本性问题。它们涉及最“国家”的能力之一——生活在一个国家——然而，由于申根安排允许在欧盟大部分地区自由流动，因此产生了整个联盟的影响。布鲁塞尔与提供签证和护照以换取投资的国家之间存在长期争执。

;

;欧盟委员会和 ;富裕国家智库经合组织长期以来一直担心黄金签证为洗钱活动提供掩护。这些担忧并非没有根据。例如，在希腊，中国投资者于 2018 年被指控参与了一场骗局，一名希腊开发商以市场价购买房产，然后以高价出售给中国的潜在投资移民，然后向他们偿还部分费用。

;

;

;;U;;NTIL RECENTLY; Captain James Cook was not a particularly controversial figure.但今年 1 月，墨尔本一座 18 世纪英国水手兼探险家的雕像被推倒，底座上喷上了“殖民地将陷落”的字样。在夏威夷，库克记忆中的一座方尖碑被涂上了红色油漆，上面写着“你在祖国的土地上”。 Cook has joined Edward Colston, Robert Clive and Cecil Rhodes as a focal point for anti-colonialist ire.

;
;
;
;
;
;

;;M;;ORE THAN; two decades have passed since we published an academic paper linking the legalisation of abortion to the enormous decline in American crime since the 1990s.基本理论很简单。出生时不受欢迎的儿童面临着一系列不良生活结果的风险，并在以后的生活中犯下更多的犯罪。堕胎合法化大大减少了意外生育的数量。 Consequently, legalised abortion will reduce crime, albeit with substantial lags.

;

;Our paper created much controversy, which was further stoked by a chapter on the topic in the best-selling book “Freakonomics”, written by one of us with Stephen Dubner, published in 2005. For many, it was more important to spin a political response to our hypothesis than to evaluate whether it was correct.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The data available at the time strongly supported our hypothesis. We showed, for instance, that crime began falling sooner in the five states that legalised abortion in advance of ;Roe v Wade;, the US Supreme Court decision that made abortion available legally nationwide.我们记录了堕胎率高和低的州的犯罪多年来遵循几乎相同的趋势，然后只有在合法堕胎的出生群体达到犯罪年龄后才突然持续出现分歧。 Consistent with our theory, looking at arrest data, which reveal the age of the offender, the declines in crime were concentrated among those born after abortion became legal.

;

;These data patterns do not, of course, make an open-and-shut case. No randomised experiment has been conducted on this topic.我们也没有通过错误地标记我们的一个表格中的一个规范中包含的一组控制变量来帮助我们自己的案例 - 这是一个令人遗憾的错误（后来更正），导致一些人驳回了论文的所有发现。 One of the most vocal and consistently sceptical voices arguing against our findings has been ;The Economist;, which has written about our study on three occasions (most recently ;last month;), each time taking a critical and dismissive stance.

;

;We concede that reasonable people could disagree about how convincing the findings were in our initial paper. The analysis was retrospective, and there is always the concern that researchers have cherry-picked their findings, or that perhaps it was just pure coincidence that the patterns emerged.

;

;There is, however, something unique about our hypothesis, which allows a second test of the theory that is far closer to the ideal of the scientific method.从实施堕胎到受影响群体达到犯罪年龄之间存在很长的滞后期。因此，我们在 2001 年发表第一篇学术论文时就已经可以对我们的理论对未来犯罪的预测做出强有力的预测。事实上，在那篇论文的最后，我们做出了以下预测：“当大约 20 年后达到稳定状态时，堕胎的影响将大约是迄今为止所感受到的影响的两倍。 Our results suggest that all else equal, legalised abortion will account for persistent declines of 1% a year in crime over the next two decades.”

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;It is rare—almost unprecedented—in academic economics to be able to make a testable prediction and then to go back and actually test it decades later. That's what we did in a ;paper; published in 2020. Our methodological approach was straightforward: mimic the specifications reported in our original paper, but limit the time period to the years that were out of sample, ie, those after our original data ended.

;

;The results provided stunning corroboration of our predictions. For each of the seven different analyses we had presented in the initial 2001 paper, the results for next two decades of data were at least as strong as the results in our initial dataset, and in most specifications even stronger. This included what the main critics of our 2001 paper called the “crucial” test, showing that the abortion rate at the time of any birth cohort negatively correlated with the age-specific arrest rate for that cohort years later as it moved through ages 15–24, while perfectly controlling for whatever other factors were influencing crime in a given state and a given year. We would argue that, short of a randomised experiment, this is some of the most compelling evidence one could present.

;

;The magnitude of the implied impacts we are talking about is huge. If you look over the entire sample, violent-crime rates fell by 62.2 percentage points in high-abortion states whereas they rose by 3.1% in low-abortion states.

;

;Though there is not complete acceptance of our hypothesis among academics, all agree that if our paper is not correct, then there is no viable explanation for the enormous drop in crime in America that started in the early 1990s.事实上，甚至没有一个有争议的理论可以取代堕胎与犯罪的联系。暴露于环境中的铅也许是下一个最好的假设。 But as we showed in our 2020 paper, when one controls for both environmental lead and abortion, the coefficient on abortion remains large while the coefficient on environmental lead is greatly reduced and loses statistical significance.

;

;It seems fair to ask why, in spite of strong supporting evidence, no academic contradiction of any of the findings of our 2020 paper and support for the abortion-crime link from ;international evidence;, so many observers remain sceptical of the hypothesis.毫不奇怪，那些在犯罪率大幅下降期间靠打击犯罪谋生的人并不热衷于得出这样的结论：他们的方法——无论是更多的警察、更多的监禁还是特定的社会计划——无论它们多么重要，都不是犯罪率下降的主导因素。 。另一种可能的解释是，不同政治派别的人们都对我们的结论感到不安。 Many people would prefer that our hypothesis not be true—perhaps not recognising that the core finding is that when women can control their fertility the life outcomes of their children are greatly enhanced.

;

;History is full of instances where new scientific theories were resisted by those who found them inconvenient. By and large, history hasn't been kind to the resisters.;■;

;But there are reasons for optimism too.尽管 2,000 平方公里的损失是悲惨的，但这意味着森林砍伐量比前一年减少了 24%，当时大约有 2,600 平方公里的森林被毁。巴西和哥伦比亚在遏制森林砍伐方面做得最多，恰逢两国亲环境总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦和古斯塔沃·佩特罗上任。保护亚马逊还有很多工作要做，但令人鼓舞的是，政治意愿在如此短的时间内产生了如此大的影响。 Mr Petro and Lula, as he is known, were elected in 2022 and 2023 respectively.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The tree-loss figures are based on a new report by Global Forest Watch, a collaboration between the World Resources Institute, a non-profit in Washington, and researchers based at the University of Maryland. Using images collected by a ;NASA; satellite, researchers map primary tropical forest across the globe on a 30m by 30m scale.通过比较这些地图随时间的变化，他们甚至可以检测到小面积的树木损失。 The data show whether trees were lost to fires, but further analysis is required to determine which tracts of forest are lost to intentional deforestation.

;

;Brazil was the country with the largest decrease in deforestation last year. The country still lost more primary forest than anywhere else in the world—1,100 square kilometres, equivalent to around half the area of New Jersey—this figure was down 36% from 2022. It is Brazil's lowest level of deforestation since 2015. Estimates from the country's National Institute for Space Research also show a significant decrease, of 22% year on year, in the Brazilian Amazon between August 2022 and July 2023.

;

;Much credit goes to Lula. In June he ;pledged to end deforestation; in the Brazilian Amazon by 2030. He promised to reverse many of the anti-environmental measures put in place by his predecessor, Jair Bolsnaro, who slashed funding for Brazil's environmental agency and fired its bosses.

;

;One part of Lula's plan is to recognise new indigenous territories in the Amazon, thereby granting them legal protections against illegal miners and loggers.土著土地遭受的森林砍伐往往比私有土地少得多。他恢复了指定这些地区的委员会，并一直在与反对派提出的一项可能破坏这一进程的法案作斗争。 So far only eight new territories have been recognised since January 2023, bringing the total number to 498, but at least 200 more are being processed.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Lula has also boosted ;law enforcement;.特别是在博尔索纳罗执政期间，环境犯罪常常被忽视。现任总统承诺在亚马逊地区开设 39 个新的警察基地。新技术正在发挥作用。 The Brazilian Federal Police now use daily images collected by Planet, an American satellite firm, and processed by ;SCCON;, a Brazilian tech company, to detect deforestation and track illegal activity in real-time. The programme claims to have resulted in over 140 arrest warrants and led to the collection of more than $3.1bn.

;

;But although Lula's anti-deforestation campaign has had a strong start, there are some signs that it may be faltering. Ongoing strikes by Brazil's civil servants are hampering enforcement efforts—data show that environmental fines in some regions halved in the first quarter of this year compared with the same period in 2023. Additionally, after a forceful push to remove illegal gold miners from Yanomami, Brazil's largest indigenous territory, in early 2023, many have returned. The Brazilian army allegedly scaled back their operations in the area in mid-2023, leaving the environmental protection agency to fend off miners alone.

;

;;Mr Petro; is the Amazon's other new champion.根据全球森林观察报告，与 2022 年相比，2023 年哥伦比亚原始森林损失大幅下降 49%。损失的面积不是大约相当于 20 个曼哈顿的面积，而是损失了约 10 至 660 平方公里。 Government estimates for the first nine months of 2023 corroborated Global Forest Watch numbers here, too.

;

;When Mr Petro took office he announced a host of new policies to curb deforestation, including paying local people to prevent tree felling. But less-official actors have made a difference too. In May 2022 Estado Mayor Central (;EMC;), an armed guerrilla group which controls sections of the Amazon, announced that it would enforce its own ban on deforestation. Where Mr Petro offered a carrot, ;EMC; preferred the stick.他们宣布对每公顷森林砍伐处以 100 万哥伦比亚比索（250 美元）的罚款。 According to Al Jazeera, an ;EMC; spokesperson claims that their motivation is purely environmental, but some see its interest in nature as a bargaining chip for ongoing peace talks with the government. The future of Colombia's forests is highly dependent on the government's relationship with ;EMC; and other armed groups; deforestation surged after peace broke down in the country in 2016.

;

;Internal politics are not the only force behind the reduction in deforestation.德国、挪威和英国等富裕国家越来越多地向亚马逊基金等项目捐款，该基金是一项价值 10 亿美元的倡议，为南美国家提供财政激励，以制止或减缓森林砍伐。 Last year the ;EU;'s Deforestation Regulation came into force.到 2024 年底，从事七种不同商品贸易的公司必须证明其货物并非来自最近砍伐的森林土地。 Many private companies are also adopting voluntary measures to ensure they are not complicit in illegal deforestation at any point along their supply chain.

;

;It is not all good news—in Bolivia primary forest loss surged by 27% year-on-year in 2023. The country lost nearly 5,000 square kilometres, the third-largest loss of any tropical country, almost as much as the Democratic Republic of Congo, and far more than Indonesia, despite having less than half the forested area of either. Most of the losses in the country were caused by fires, which are often intentionally set by humans to clear land for agriculture.

;

;Lula and Mr Petro have pushed other South American leaders to adopt more environmentally friendly policies.八月，亚马逊八个国家签署了一项结束森林砍伐并防止雨林达到“临界点”的宣言。 Preliminary figures for January and February 2024 show further reductions in Amazon deforestation compared to 2023. Hopefully this is only the beginning. ;■;

;;I;;T HAS BEEN; a few days since a 250kg Russian glide bomb landed in Iryna Tymokhyna's courtyard on 23rd August Street, and it is fair to say she is not happy.这位 60 岁的老人坐在公园的长椅上（后来变成了她的客厅），咒骂弗拉基米尔·普京和她认为仍在帮助他的少数哈尔科夫居民。她说，她的公寓布满灰尘和碎玻璃；她的邻居被送往医院，一名路过的自行车快递员被杀。 “If it was up to me, I would shoot the bastards...and I'd wipe Belgorod [the closest Russian city] off the face of the earth while I was at it.”

;;
;;
;

;Ms Tymokhyna's sharp language is striking for the fact she was born in Russia, and most of her relatives still live there. But her outrage is far from unique in a 1.3m-person city now living through ;an airborne terror; mostly originating from the region just across the border.

;;
;

;;Read more of our recent coverage of the ;Ukraine war;;

;
;

;Russia stepped up its bombardment of Kharkiv in December, around the time that ;problems with American military assistance; began to make headlines.从那时起，这座城市受到的弹道导弹数量比战争开始以来的任何时候都多。无人机袭击变得更加频繁：它们飞得更快更高，并且机翼上有碳纤维涂层，这使得击落它们变得更加困难。 But the March 27th attack on 23rd August Street was perhaps the pivotal moment, marking the first time a glide bomb, launched from a plane and capable of travelling tens of kilometres to devastating effect, had been used against Ukraine's second city.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The attack came just five days after a missile barrage destroyed almost all of Kharkiv's power-generation capacity. It has been followed by more than a week of operations using glide bombs, missiles and drones, killing at least 16 and injuring another 50. There was a sinister evolution in tactics too, with “double-tap” strikes (repeated shots on the same position) that appeared to target first responders. The escalation had military sources in Kyiv suggesting that Russia has resolved to make the city a “grey zone”, uninhabitable for civilians.

;

;The man with responsibility for keeping Kharkiv running pushes back strongly against that hypothesis.市长伊霍尔·捷列霍夫在工业区的一个秘密地点接受采访时表示，他的城市无意放弃。 Things were worse ;at the start of the war;, he argues, when all but 300,000 of the pre-war population of 2m fled. “怎么能让这样的城市变成灰色地带呢？人们不会离开，因为他们已经离开了，然后又回来了。他们已经受够了折磨了。”是的，在没有发电站或工作变压器的情况下为城市供电是一项艰巨的挑战，但他们已经做到了。 “如果我告诉你我们是如何做到的，那也会成为目标。”但如果西方能够提供强大的防空系统或能够击退携带新型炸弹的战斗机的 F-16，那么这座城市的许多问题都可以得到解决。 ;The Economist; understands that Russia destroyed some of the Western-supplied Patriot air-defence units that Ukraine had been using to protect cities like Kharkiv.

;

;Russia's exact intentions are not clear at this stage, though there are clear signs that it is preparing for a major summer offensive. A Ukrainian source with knowledge of the intelligence picture said Russia is currently training six divisions (approximately 120,000 troops) in eastern Siberia. 4 月 3 日，总统泽连斯基表示，俄罗斯将在 6 月再动员 30 万人。哈尔科夫是未来袭击的几个可能方向之一。这不是最有可能的，但它已经受到俄罗斯媒体的广泛关注。这可能表明克里姆林宫正在开展信息宣传活动，以恐吓哈尔科夫居民。 Or it could be a nod in the direction of a pro-war camp agitating for a fiercer response to Ukraine's frequent attacks on Belgorod,  which are also causing unease in Western circles. In March, Vladimir Putin talked about the creation of a “buffer zone” on Ukraine's border.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;A military operation to seize Kharkiv would be a tall order for Russia.上一次尝试是在 2022 年，当时这座城市的防守更加薄弱，但它以惨败告终。占领这座城市需要突破乌克兰的防御并包围它，而俄罗斯根本无法做到这一点；建立空中优势，这不是既定的；并赢得一场血腥的城市战役。 “他们很可能不会成功，”乌克兰专家、前国防部长安德烈·扎戈罗德纽克 (Andriy Zagorodnyuk) 表示。对于其他人来说，他们仍然担心，当俄罗斯人意识到自己无法得到他们想要的东西时，他们会变得更加邪恶。 “他们可能无法占领哈尔科夫，但可能会摧毁它，”当地商人、后来成为特种部队侦察指挥官的丹尼斯·雅罗斯拉夫斯基 (Denys Yaroslavsky) 说。 “We'd be talking about something of the order of Aleppo.”

;

;Some have already taken the hint and packed their bags.记者兼前医生伊琳娜·沃丘克 (Iryna Voichuk) 在滑翔炸弹开始袭击后不久于三月底前往欧洲。她的神经已经受不了了。离开这座城市就像离开了一位朋友，她说：“尽管有危险，我还是很高兴住在那里，但当一枚导弹落在距我公寓 100m 的地方时，情况发生了变化。” 2022 年，哈尔科夫的大部分商业活动连同其最富有的居民都消失了。能源短缺和军事升级正在考验着剩下的企业的决心。尤里·萨普罗诺夫（Yury Sapronov）是该市为数不多的大商人之一，他坚称，其中除了一些孤立的案例外，到目前为止还没有出现人员外逃或恐慌的情况。 “我不能说哈尔科夫会突然从大量投资涌入中受益，因为我们无法移动俄罗斯边境。 But we will survive and small businesses can even prosper from internal demand.”

;

;If others have written Kharkiv off, those inside the city have yet to receive the memo.尽管每天都有十几个空袭警报，但城市生活仍在继续。尽管偶尔会有导弹落在附近，但家人还是在城市的中央公园散步。孩子们在军事设施旁边踢足球。这座城市开始在地下建造学校的决定也许最好地概括了挖掘的意义。其中第一家位于西部工业区，将于本月春假后开业。该设施耗资约 1 亿格里夫纳（250 万美元），通过一个从运动场不协调地伸出的防爆门进入。这所学校是用钢筋混凝土建造的，在地下几米处，应该能经受住俄罗斯的任何攻击。 Already all 900 spots in the first intake have been reserved.

;

;Ms Tymokhyna, who offers ;The Economist; tea in her park-bench living room, says she is happy to lend a hand with any additional digging that is needed.两年来的炸弹和导弹对她的健康造成了影响，她的神经崩溃了。战争开始时她在帐篷里住了两个月。但是，她说，为了保卫这个 43 年来一直是她的家的自由国家，她会不择手段。 “我已经 60 岁了，但我已经准备好带着我的铁锹去任何需要我的地方，”她说。 “无论需要什么，都可以调制燃烧弹、酸液。乌克兰对我来说就是一切。如果俄罗斯人敢来这里，我就找到他们。 They won't have a hope of staying in the realm of the living.”;■;

;;I;;N RECENT MONTHS; Tesla has had a bumpy ride. In January the electric-vehicle (;EV;) pioneer warned that growth would be “notably lower” this year, as motorists' enthusiasm for battery power loses charge. The same month it had to suspend most production at its giant factory near Berlin because of supply disruptions caused by turmoil in the Red Sea. Its market share in China, the world's biggest ;EV; market, is falling as it fends off cheaper local competition, especially from ;;BYD;;, which late last year briefly eclipsed Tesla as the world's biggest ; EV-;maker.

;

;Tesla hit another big pothole on April 2nd, when it reported that it had delivered fewer than 390,000 cars在第一季度。这一数字比一年前下降了 8.5%，远低于本已谨慎的华尔街分析师的预期。特斯拉的市值今年已下跌三分之一，至不足 5500 亿美元。 That is still more than any other carmaker but a far cry from the $1.2trn it was worth in 2021. Its boss, Elon Musk, is now only the world's third-richest man.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;If you think the billionaire and his firm are having a rough time, spare a thought for their once-white-hot imitators. Three years ago, as Mr Musk showed that ;EV;-making could be a trillion-dollar business, investors scrambled to back the newcomers promising to be the next Tesla.那年早些时候上市的两家美国初创公司正像他们的汽车一样迅速加速。 Lucid Motors成立于2007年，市值超过900亿美元； that of Rivian, created two years later, hit around $150bn. Each was worth more than Ford, which was nearly 120 years old and sold 4m vehicles in 2021, compared with 125 for Lucid and 920 for Rivian. Chinese rivals such as Li Auto (founded in 2015), Nio and Xpeng (both in 2014) were also valued richly. In late 2021 the combined market value of six prominent Tesla wannabes hit a stonking $400bn.

;;
;;
;

;Today the six are worth $65bn, and falling (see chart).成立八年的美国公司 Fisker 和成立五年的中国公司 HiPhi 已暂停生产。 3月25日，股价暴跌导致菲斯克股票暂停交易，该公司可能很快就会退市。 HiPhi may be looking to sell itself to a big established Chinese carmaker. Faraday Future, which sold barely 11 of its upmarket ;EV;s last year, is teetering on the brink of bankruptcy. Lordstown, an American startup founded in 2018 to make electric pickups and ;SUV;s, went bust in 2023.

;

;即使是实力稍强的公司也在苦苦挣扎。 VinFast, a Vietnamese firm which was set up in 2017 and went public last year, briefly—and bafflingly—almost touched $190bn in market value last August. It sold 35,000 ;EV;s in 2023 and is now worth $11bn. Rivian sold 50,000 and is worth a fifteenth of its peak in 2021. Lucid sold 6,000 and is also worth one-fifteenth. Li Auto, Leapmotor, Nio and Xpeng, which delivered over 800,000 cars between them last year, have also seen their share prices shrivel. Only Li turns a profit, mostly because it manufactures nothing but hybrid vehicles; its market value plunged recently after it revealed its first pure ;EV;. Surviving—let alone thriving—in what was meant to be a brave new electric world is proving tough. Which Tesla wannabes, if any, will make it?

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;It was all meant to be different. Making money from internal combustion engines, whose thousands of moving parts drove up complexity and costs, required carmakers to churn out large volumes.相比之下，电池动力的新经济本应降低进入壁垒。这些电动新贵模仿特斯拉，将自己定位为科技公司而不是制造商，他们认为，他们可以通过使用更简单的设计和重新构想生产流程来控制成本，而传统企业则无法做到这一点。 Components such as batteries and electric motors can be bought off the shelf, leaving the ;EV;-makers to focus on developing whizzy software that would allow their vehicles to stand out thanks to a better in-car experience, from infotainment to mood lighting. Some companies, like Fisker, simply outsourced the metal-bending.

;

;These advantages have, however, failed to outweigh the old-school ;need for critical mass;.要从汽车中盈利仍然需要每年生产大约 50 万辆汽车。 “Scale is vital and manufacturing is hard,” sums up Tu Le of Sino Auto Insights, a consultancy. Though Tesla began as a luxury marque, putting big and pricey batteries in big and pricey cars, it always eyed the mass market. Profits started streaming in only once it overcame the near-death experience— “production hell”, in Mr Musk's words—of trying to churn out high numbers of its cheaper Model 3.

;

;The Tesla wannabes, for their part, have taken too long to start production and are now taking too long to launch new models, says Pedro Pacheco of Gartner, a consultancy.投资银行杰富瑞 (Jefferies) 的菲利普·霍乔伊斯 (Philippe Houchois) 指出，仅服务于高利润、高价格的利基市场，生存的机会很低。 Just look at the possibly futureless Faraday Future, whose models start at $250,000.

;

;The electric insurgents are waking up to the reality.他们的第一步是寻找低端市场。 On March 7th Rivian announced three less expensive models that will start arriving in 2026. Last year Xpeng signed a deal with Didi Global, a Chinese ride-hailing giant, to make cheaper cars and forged a partnership with Volkswagen to make mass-market ;EV;s for China.蔚来计划推出两个价格实惠的子品牌：Alps 和 Firefly。就连汽车售价高达 25 万美元的 Lucid 也计划在几年内推出价格不那么独特的 5 万美元车型。 In October Leapmotor sold a 20% stake to Stellantis, a mass-market behemoth whose marques include Citroën, Chrysler, Fiat and Peugeot (and whose largest shareholder part-owns ;The Economist;'s parent company), for $1.6bn. The pair will team up to make ;EV;s.

;

;To succeed, these efforts must still produce a competitive product具有独特的功能。特斯拉通过将技术放在首位而实现了这一目标。 The result was a desirable ;EV; that wasn't cheap but offered a svelte look and decent range;传统行业的早期尝试，例如日产聆风，价格昂贵，但也很丑陋，而且动力不足。 Despite a strong tech focus like Tesla, most startups have failed to deliver unique products at competitive cost, as they continue to lack scale, says Patrick Hummel of ;UBS;, a bank. Now the novelty of clever ;EV; technology “has worn off”, adds Becrom Basu of ;LEK;, another consultancy. Good range and other once-cutting-edge tech is considered table stakes, including for incumbent carmakers with considerably beefier manufacturing chops.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;As a result, many of the ;EV; entrants lack unique selling features. Rivian 和 Lucid 制造的汽车在技术上并不起眼。仅凭它们的漂亮外观并不能证明其高昂的价格是合理的。 Rivian's cheapest electric pickup costs around $70,000, half as much again as Ford's ;F;-150 Lightning without offering one-and-a-half as much car. In Europe the Lucid Air, a luxury saloon, is significantly pricier than comparable electric ;BMW;s or Mercedes. Fisker's mass-market ;EV;s are also well designed but still cost more than Chinese rivals with similar features, partly because its asset-light outsourcing strategy does not work well for cheaper cars.为什么有人会购买 VinFast 仍然是个谜； reviews of its ;VF;8 ;SUV; were damning, to put it charitably.

;

;由于产品需求不温不火，许多公司需要更多资金来维持运营。 3 月 25 日，Lucid 表示，它已成功从其最大投资者沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金那里再筹集 10 亿美元。许多竞争对手就没那么幸运了。截至 2023 年底，Rivian 拥有 94 亿美元的净现金，但还需要数十亿美元来打造更便宜的车型。那些拥有看似合理的 PowerPoint 演示文稿和对时尚电动汽车的艺术印象的公司，有钱人会大肆投资的日子已经一去不复返了。在 2021 年之前的几年里，他们投入了数十亿美元，却发现数十亿美元被付诸东流，他们对错过最后期限、令人失望的新模型和不断黯淡的利润前景表示怀疑。 Their second thoughts have not been dispelled by the recent slowdown in growth of ;EV; sales in many countries.现有的汽车制造商没有兴趣拯救叛乱分子。 Mr Hummel of ;UBS; thinks that most of the startups will simply disappear.

;

;The likeliest to survive are the Chinese 。原因之一是它们似乎是这群人中最具创新性的。 Nio's upmarket ;EV;s come with the option of battery swapping and, in China at least, a vast network of stations to do it.驾驶员无需下车即可在几分钟内上路。 Bernstein, a broker, considers Xpeng one of the leaders in autonomous-driving technology.

;

;They are also a relative bargain compared with their Western rivals 。 Both Nio and Xpeng, as well as Li Auto, have benefited from an impressive battery supply chain, dominated by Chinese firms like ;CATL;, and steadfast support from central and local governments, notes Mr Le.这反过来又使中国公司能够降低成本和价格。 The result has been rapid uptake of ;EV;s in their giant domestic market, and with it greater economies of scale.

;

;And another wave of carmaking disruption may be swelling in China, courtesy of ;Chinese big tech;. In 2021 Seres, an established Chinese car company, and Huawei, the closest thing China has to a national tech champion, jointly launched ;AITO;, a new brand dripping with fancy tech. 1 月份，该合资企业交付了 33,000 辆汽车。 On March 28th Xiaomi, which has hitherto made mostly smartphones, launched its first ;SUV;. The car, made by ;BAIC;, a state-owned car giant, and costing as little as $30,000, attracted 90,000 orders in 24 hours.

;Xiaomi aims to take on, at least in China, both Tesla and ;BYD;.
